intro: Cacalia gerrardii, commonly known as the narrowleaf false violet, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny areas such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its flowers are usually white or pale purple and bloom in early spring. Cacalia gerrardii is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to dry, arid environments.
